abstract: Two prison inmates uprisings in Alabama in one week focus attention on prison  overcrowding crisis, in one of nation's poorest states, that has long bedeviled prison officials and lawmakers; state houses more than 24,000 inmates in system designed for 13,318; Gov Robert Bentley's proposal for new prisons faces uncertainty in state Legislature.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Robert Bentley’s proposal to relieve overcrowding by building four new facilities has been met with skepticism by many.

headline.main: Alabama Prison Uprisings Come as State Grapples With How to Fix System
headline.print_headline: Alabama Grapples With Fixing Prisons as Uprisings Occur
